channel.title: Programming Tutor
channel.description:
Okay, well to start I am Samantha May. I am new to the world of programming. I would really, really like to learn. I have basics kind of down. Such as changing welcome messages, adding shops, editing commands, ect. Just like everyone else here I am looking to better myself in these fields. I would like to learn how to program on another level, not just editing. If you have the extra time, and feel you can help I would love for a tutor. :] I am port-forwarded, have no-ip, and the works to run a server. I have never released anything, or even owned a server. So if you are willing to do this, I obviously may struggle in different fields.. I just want to learn 317's right now, 508 looks like Chinese writing to me still..
*I for the life of me could not find the appropriate place to post this request, I am sorry. Please just move it.* Samantha-bby@hotmail.com

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:27, topic:385122”][quote author=Rash link=topic=480887.msg3523244#msg3523244 date=1299579682]

I agree PI ain’t that good , but it’s just sooooooooooooo simplistic xD
I advice PI to train on , but if you decide to host a server , it would be best if you didn’t ( unless you can improve networking from the client to server and fix all those dupes and manage to clip PVP combat and NPC’s… )

Want her to learn bad habits?
[/quote]

i’m only suggesting PI to learn Java basics ( practical use that is ) , otherwise he / she could also find a great guide / tutorial / book / teacher w/e on Java , ilearned it mostly by messing with PI and then i started taking class =D[/quote]

She can learn just as easy using hyperion, runesource, stonefall, or shard.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Wintercanon:

No I was implying that PI must be restarted frequently even without applying core updates (or minor ones since it doesn’t utilise scripting). This is because it is wastes and consumes memory, has lengthy processors and the delays cause packets to become malformed.

oh , uhm , nope , i can let my server run all day long , ( not hosted online , )
however , one time i did host my server and had a three day long session with my friends , no lagg / DC’s involved

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

No I was implying that PI must be restarted frequently even without applying core updates (or minor ones since it doesn’t utilise scripting). This is because it is wastes and consumes memory, has lengthy processors and the delays cause packets to become malformed.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:22, topic:385122”][quote author=Cres link=topic=480887.msg3523219#msg3523219 date=1299577569]

It shuts down, all players are disconnected and unsaved games are lost.

i’ve never witnessed this o.0
i usually play PI based servers , occasionally we get a rollack but no DC’s and our saves never got deleted ( unless manualy by the server owner …)
[/quote]Theoretically a gameserver should run indefinitely if it receives no excessive traffic (private servers don’t receive excessive traffic unless they’re being DoS attacked), as they shouldn’t consume much memory. Does a PI server need to be restarted besides recompiling?[/quote]

yes , you must close , compile and re- run your server , i think it can be changed so you can compile without having to restart , but i’ve never really tried

Read full topic

Insert Quote Project Insanity is dirt. It is written so poorly the cycle is thrown off and there are memory leaks. Which means your server will ALWAYS be lagging and will eventually self-destruct.

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Sammy_May, post:11, topic:385122”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=480887.msg3521829#msg3521829 date=1299453147]
I actually suggest reading a few Java tutorials/e-books before starting on a server.

Do you understand data types, etc?

Anywho, I recommend you download an IDE before starting any programming, as they will help you along the way. Top three favorite, Eclipse, Netbeans, IntelliJ IDEA.

These can help you fix conventions with the ease of a button, so you can use any base you want.

If you want to learn efficiently, you should use something like Hyperion, Rs2hd, RsDaemon, etc. Though, these are extremely blank bases, and need all content added, which may be a bit hard if you don’t know much about the RS2 protocol. So, I would recommend something fairly easy, such as Delta, or Project Insanity. (These aren’t good bases to host, but they are decent to start programming on)
[/quote]

Everyone has recommended Project Insanity so I will go with, is Netbeans hard to use? I don’t have any way to get ahold of a java programming book sadly. That’s why I requested a tutor(:[/quote]

Do not use project insanity, please.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @Sammy_May Sammy_May
item.description:
@Sammy_May wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I actually suggest reading a few Java tutorials/e-books before starting on a server.

Do you understand data types, etc?

Anywho, I recommend you download an IDE before starting any programming, as they will help you along the way. Top three favorite, Eclipse, Netbeans, IntelliJ IDEA.

These can help you fix conventions with the ease of a button, so you can use any base you want.

If you want to learn efficiently, you should use something like Hyperion, Rs2hd, RsDaemon, etc. Though, these are extremely blank bases, and need all content added, which may be a bit hard if you don’t know much about the RS2 protocol. So, I would recommend something fairly easy, such as Delta, or Project Insanity. (These aren’t good bases to host, but they are decent to start programming on)[/quote]

Everyone has recommended Project Insanity so I will go with, is Netbeans hard to use? I don’t have any way to get ahold of a java programming book sadly. That’s why I requested a tutor(:

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @Sammy_May Sammy_May
item.description:
@Sammy_May wrote:

That's why it doesn't mean much. It gets abused so easily. Anywho, welcome to MoparScape.

Oh I see. Well thank you! Guess I have to start somewhere to become great! Do you have any recommendations for a base I should start with as a beginning programmer? Something with good conventions so I can learn properly preferably.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming Tutor
item.dc:creator: @Sammy_May Sammy_May
item.description:
@Sammy_May wrote:

Don't be fooled so easily. Reputation has no meaning on these forums, and anywho who begs to differ is an idiot.

Ahh, well I am new to these forums so I don’t know yet…
I’ll note that though, everyone seems to have 200 rep?

Im stupid tho.

I bet your not.

Well requesting a coder is against the rules but anyway.. Really, your first stop should be at a good book. Try looking at this topic, should be a great help.

I guess it’s a good thing I requested a tutor and not a coder then?
Thank you for the link, I’ll go check it out.

Read full topic
